hackathon-description-text: Social Hacks is a 24-hour, student-run hackathon that brings together students, programmers, technologists, and activists in New York City to collaborate on technological solutions. Prizes will be given for the best hacks in each category as well as an overall best hack.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Equity Research Analyst at Bank of America Merrill Lynch
Software Engineer at Rent the Runway
Coordinator of CS Teacher Education at Hunter College

hackathon-eligibility: Checked-in and demoed the project at Social Hacks. Form teams of 1 to 4 individuals. Your project must be submitted to Devpost to be eligible for prizes.
hackathon-requirements: There are three main categories to choose from:

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Mental Health Hack: Sketch App for Mac and UNITEK Wireless Bluetooth Speaker
Best Inequality Hack: Snowden Movie Blu-ray Combo and UNITEK Wireless Bluetooth Speaker
Best Environment Hack: Raspberry Pi and UNITEK Wireless Bluetooth Speaker
Best Overall Hack: Clerky and UNITEK Wireless Bluetooth Speaker

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=99 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is this project technically interesting or difficult?
How much of an impact does this hack have in its specific category?
Is it a unique idea or a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is this app useful and will people really use it? Will it fulfill a need in a community?
Is this hack aesthetic and well-designed? Is it put together?

hackathon-location-address: 99 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
hackathon-description-header: Hack the world's toughest social issues—climate change, poverty, and more.
